p:
Egg albumin denaturation inhibition method was used to investigate the anti-inflammatory potential of 6-gingerol. The reaction mixture (5 ml) contained 200 μl of hen's egg albumin (fresh), 2.8 ml of phosphate buffer (pH 6.4), and 2 ml of various concentrations (100-600 μg/ml) of 6-gingerol or standard drug (diclofenac sodium 200 μg/ml), and 2 ml of distilled water was used instead of extract or diclofenac to prepare the control. The reaction mixtures were incubated for 15 min at room temperature in a BOD incubator, and then the reaction mixtures were heated at 70°C for 5 min. After cooling, the absorbance of reaction mixtures was measured at 660 nm using a UV-visible spectrophotometer using the buffer as the blank.
